definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.chinese: 那些小老鼠也都爬開了。

sentences.english: A gang of little mice have come out to steal oil.
sentences.chinese: 一羣小老鼠出來偷油喫，他們偷到了嗎？

sentences.english: Little mouse climbing wall, the wall of praise is admired the world's greatest.
sentences.chinese: 小老鼠爬到牆邊十分景仰的讚美牆是世界上最偉大的。

sentences.english: And they caught the little mousie;
sentences.chinese: 就是它們咬住了小老鼠。

sentences.english: But his loud voice scared the little mouse away.
sentences.chinese: 但是他的大嗓門已把小老鼠嚇跑了。

sentences.english: Four little mice went scampering back.
sentences.chinese: 四個小老鼠歡蹦着跑回去了。

sentences.english: What are you making us for lunch today, Mousy!
sentences.chinese: “”今天中飯你給我們做什麼喫的，小老鼠？“”

sentences.english: The little mouse heard the cry.
At last a young mouse got up3, and said that he had a good idea.
sentences.chinese: 最後，一隻小老鼠站出來說他有一個好主意。

sentences.english: Little Mouse nodded, so little witch into the Treasury.
sentences.chinese: 小老鼠點點頭，讓小女巫進了庫房。

sentences.english: Prof. Waters prefers a physiological explanation for small dogs' longer lifespans.
sentences.chinese: 沃特斯傾向於從生理學方面解釋小老鼠長壽的原因。

sentences.english: One night, a baby mouse went out for a walk with his mother for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 一天晚上一隻小老鼠同他的媽媽第一次出來散步。

sentences.english: This cute little door-mouse is as dead as a doornail.
sentences.chinese: 這個可愛的小老鼠像門釘一樣牢固。
